artist: Paul Fjelde; Depicted: John S. Bradstreet
creditline: Gift of Friends of John Scott Bradstreet
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist, artist's estate, or assignees
inscription: U.C. letters to right of bust: JOHN SCOTT BRADSTREET MDCCCVL MCMXIV | Below relief: ONE OF THE FOUNDERS AND UNTIL HIS DEATH a DIRECTOR OF THE MINNEAPOLIS SOCIETY OF FINE ARTS
life_date: Paul Fjelde, American (Minnesota), 1892–1984; John S. Bradstreet, Depicted, American, 1845–1914
text: John Scott Bradstreet (1845-1914) was one of the founders of the Minneapolis Society of Fine Arts in 1883. He was the Twin Cities most noted local furniture craftsman and interior designer who also imported and sold objects made in Asia.
title: Portrait of John Scott Bradstreet
